page.title: 12River Derwent - Matlock Bath
page.content: The{River Derwent}has been recently dredged and a pumping station erected at Bentley Brook to prevent Matlock town centre flooding.The river provides facilities for canoeing - people travel long distances to train in the white water below High Tor, both coarse and trout fishing, boating and is used to drive the turbine in Masson Mill. Every Boxing Day there is a{charity {raft race}from Matlock to Cromford Meadows which attracts very large crowds. {The Venetian Nights Festival}held in Matlock Bath each week in September and October is a unique water festival -a parade of illuminated rowing boats decorated with over 1000 electric light bulbs.They used to use up to 250 candles. It was first started in
